summary: This bill, S. 2601, amends Title 10 of the United States Code to improve planning, programming, and budget coordination for the operations of the cyber mission force of the Armed Forces. It designates the Commander of the United States Cyber Command as responsible for managing resources for training, equipping, operating, and sustaining the cyber mission force. The bill also outlines consultation requirements between the Commander, Secretaries of military departments, and the Principal Cyber Advisor of the Department of Defense regarding funding and budget proposals, particularly for reserve components.
